isis.stitle: 2 SPEED AND DOUBLE REDUCTION SINGLE DRIVE AXLES: EATON - LUBRICATION - WHEEL END

note.para: In cases where wheel equipment is being installed, either new or after maintenance activity, the lube cavities are empty. Bearings and seals must be manually supplied with adequate lubricant or they will be severely damaged before the normal motion of the vehicle can supply lube to the hub ends of the housing.

svcprocinfo.para: To avoid the risk of premature damage to wheel bearings and seals, they must be "prelubed" any time the wheel equipment is being installed. There are two methods of doing this. The correct method will depend on the type of wheel equipment being used.

step1.para: Fill axle with lube through axle housing cover filler hole.
Jack up left side of axle. Maintain this position for one minute to allow lube to flow into the wheel end on the right side.
Jack up right side. Maintain this position for one minute to allow lube to flow into the wheel end on the left side.
With vehicle level, add additional lube through housing cover filler hole. Bring lube level up to the bottom of the filler hole.

svcsubproc.title: Hubs With Filler Holes
svcsubproc.para: Pour a pint of axle lubricant into the hub through the cavity filler hole provided at each wheel end.
